titleStmt.title: Description of University of Manchester Library, Gaster Hebrew MS Add 1: Yemenite manuscript

notesStmt.note: Paper with watermarks: coat of arms with crescent and letters A C[?].
Binding detaching from spine and sewing partly visible. Folio 13 detached.
Marginal notes in different hands: folios ia, 3a, 4a, 9a, 11a, 13a-b, 17a, 19a, 21a, 31a-b, 34a, 43b, 45a-b.
The commentary, which is transmitted anonymously in the manuscript, is not found on folios 1a, 3a, 10b, 46b, 47b, 49a-50b.

msContents.summary: Nineteenth-century Yemenite manuscript with the text of the three Megillot (Scrolls) Song of Songs, Ruth, and Ecclesiastes accompanied with minimal Massorah, the Targum, Rashi's commentary and excerpts from the commentary Nahal Eshkol by Hayyim Joseph David Azulai.

msItem.title: Yemenite manuscript
msItem.author: Suleiman [...] Ibn Yuda [...]
Rashi, 1040-1105
Azulaï, Hayyîm Joseph David, 1724-1806
msItem.colophon: Folio ia in Hebrew: "וגו׳ נעתקה פה ק"ק צנעא יע"א בשנת מתוקה שנת / העבד אם מעט ואם הרבה". The letters indicating the date are in red ink and read 164 [וק-נ-בד-ב]. To this a different hand added in red ink in Hebrew: "לשטר׳ בקס"ב", which reads 162, probably missing one of the letters in the original colophon. On the right hand side the scribe's signature appears.

msItem.title: Gaster Hebrew MS Add 1/1. Title page.
Gaster Hebrew MS Add 1/8. Rashi's Commentary [ff. ib-50b].
Gaster Hebrew MS Add 1/2. Song of Songs [ff. 1a-17b]. Sublinear vocalisation and cantillation.
Gaster Hebrew MS Add 1/5. Targum Song of Songs [ff. 1a-17b]. Sublinear vocalisation.
Gaster Hebrew MS Add 1/9. Nahal Eshkol [ff. 1b-48b].
Gaster Hebrew MS Add 1/3. Ruth [ff. 18a-25b]. Sublinear vocalisation and cantillation.
Gaster Hebrew MS Add 1/6. Targum Ruth [ff. 18a-25b]. Sublinear vocalisation.
Gaster Hebrew MS Add 1/4. Ecclesiastes [ff. 26a-50b]. Sublinear vocalisation and cantillation.
Gaster Hebrew MS Add 1/7. Targum Ecclesiastes [ff. 26a-50b]. Sublinear vocalisation.

supportDesc.foliation: Modern pencil foliation in Arabic numerals at the top outer corner of side a of each folio, starting on folio 2 and continuing to 51. Missing foliation on title page (folio ia), folio 1 and the last folio (folio iia).

layoutDesc.layout: The layout is composite: the main biblical text is written in one column on the outer top side of the page, surrounded on the internal margin and at the bottom by the Aramaic Targum. In the bottom half of the page is Rashi's commentary, usually accompanied by the Nahal Eshkol commentary. The latter tends to be in the internal column.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Yemenite square script for the biblical text.
Yemenite semi-cursive script, larger for the Aramaic Targum.

decoDesc.decoNote: Several words throughout the manuscript, such as initial words, headings, titles and masoretic notes, have a red ink line, small snake or crown-like decoration above them.

iaGate drawing. Its borders are filled with grape motifs. The letters of the title, in black ink, are either surrounded with red ink lines or have a red line on top. As fillers there are six red and black ink floral motifs.
ibFleur de lys in black and red ink.
1aTwo initial-words on panels bordered by a frame filled with red grape motifs and red ink lines.
18aTwo initial-words on panels bordered by a frame filled with red grape motifs and red ink lines.
26aTwo initial-words on panels bordered by a frame filled with red grape motifs and red ink lines.

binding.p: Brown leather binding with blind tooled decoration on boards with two double-lined frames and diagonal lines. Broken leather ties. Traces of 3 decorative ornamental appliques, now absent, on both boards.

origin.p: Produced in Ṣanʻā', Yemen in the year 164 of the Seleucid Era (= 1853). The title page includes the production year: this is indicated by 6 red letters part of words (in a biblical verse). Below, a different hand added in Hebrew in red ink the words "לשטר' בקסב" which corresponds to the year 162=1851; year 164 of the Seleucid Era (=1853)

history.provenance: Acquired by The John Rylands Library from the heirs of Moses Gaster in 1954. Paper label on spine with 1814 handwritten in ink. Front paste-down: Handwritten note reading in English: "30.10.1923 / Presented to me by W.A. Howitt / M.G.". Front paste-down: Handwritten notes in pencil reading "1599", "Levy of sale", "[...], MSS 397 / Solomon's Song / of Songs / with a Commentary", "1851"; and in blue ink "1814". Folio 50b: Signature of Moses Gaster. Folio 51a: Handwritten in pencil number 5054. Folio iib: Handwritten Hebrew alphabet, upside down. Back paste-down: Handwritten ownership note in Hebrew, including the name Mahmud (מחמוד).
